LGRVITS2CZU36MOSXUZM5475T4.body:
What happens after a company is delisted?
Keep in mind that the delisting of a company doesn't mean that the stock can't continue to trade. Delisted companies can choose to be listed on the over-the-counter (OTC) markets or on the pink sheets. There are some negative implications resulting from delisting, such as a loss of investor confidence, and potentially reduced access to capital, but it's not necessarily a death sentence. Companies can (and have) return to compliance and relist on the NASDAQ after delisting.

NGZG7YHYI4MFWRVEINEVGY3LEA.body: For this company to survive, Lu has to leave. He has basically made his money through the margin loans and he doesn't really care about the stock price anymore. For him the best outcome to for the company to go bankrupt so that few people would have an interest for further investigations.

5C3Q5FYGHS4SCB7H5LIBDU4HLU.body:
Formal LK update as of 6:20PM EST. 

1. Luckin was unable to meet the requirements in time for yesterday’s delisting appeal meeting and therefore were forced to withdraw their appeal process. (How could they appeal when they are in the middle of making the necessary changes). As a result they will be delisted and after today there will be no trading allowed for this stock. 

2. On July 2 Luckin directors are having a meeting to fire Chairman Lu. (The head of the fraud, this is good news)

3. On July 5 the directors will have a meeting to decide the date of a few other directors. (Further purge bad apples, again this is good news)

4. Once the votes and decisions have been made then a business plan will be out together in partnership with their current advisor company on how to best move forward.

5. My opinion: the bad apples will be removed, the best business plan possible will be put together and executed and financials will be released. Stock will resume trading in OTC and continue to grow and possibly join Nasdaq again in the future. Stock price will still go up in OTC regardless of future Nasdaq listing. 

6. Worst case scenario for longs is that the company complete files for bankruptcy and disappears. We already lost 95%. But if this was the case then why would the board of directors be fighting so hard to save the company? They want to protect their investments.

HAHAHAAHAHAAHAHAAH Remember when I told everyone on here you cant trust the chinese and people down voted me and yelled how I was racist? Well it turns out LK withdrew their request for a hearing to stop the delisting LOL you literally handed your life savings to a small group of chinese men who are laughing at you. Today, Luckin announced that it withdrew its request for a hearing with Nasdaq and would no longer seek to contest the delisting of its stock. As a result, Luckin's shares will be suspended from trading on the Nasdaq Stock Market at the open of business on June 29 and will be delisted once the appeal period has expired.

C2F7EU4ZKN6MDCBYM4XWOELWK4.body: Looks like the shorts that didnt cover, thinking  they are gonna wait for the liquidation of the company, may of screwed themselves out of getting paid for their transaction. Apparently there is a High Profile M&A Specialist on board , which would explain the withdraw from the appeal hearing. Now the shorts are trapped in their positions with no clear cut path to take the ADR price to zero; the withdraw,which lead to the halt, and soon to be delisting, may have been a strategic move to screw shortie by trapping the beast and giving the ADR a continuance in its own right until the company restructures and gets its paperwork in order - OUCH!

(How could they appeal when they are in the middle of making the necessary changes). As a result they will be delisted and after today there will be no trading allowed for this stock. 

2. On July 2 Luckin directors are having a meeting to fire Chairman Lu. (The head of the fraud, this is good news)

3. On July 5 the directors will have a meeting to decide the date of a few other directors. (Further purge bad apples, again this is good news)

4. Once the votes and decisions have been made then a business plan will be out together in partnership with their current advisor company on how to best move forward.

5. My opinion: the bad apples will be removed, the best business plan possible will be put together and executed and financials will be released. Stock will resume trading in OTC and continue to grow and possibly join Nasdaq again in the future. Stock price will still go up in OTC regardless of future Nasdaq listing. 

6. Worst case scenario for longs is that the company complete files for bankruptcy and disappears. We already lost 95%. But if this was the case then why would the board of directors be fighting so hard to save the company? They want to protect their investments.

C2F7EU4ZKN6MDCBYM4XWOELWK4.body: Looks like the shorts that didnt cover, thinking  they are gonna wait for the liquidation of the company, may of screwed themselves out of getting paid for their transaction. Apparently there is a High Profile M&A Specialist on board , which would explain the withdraw from the appeal hearing. Now the shorts are trapped in their positions with no clear cut path to take the ADR price to zero; the withdraw,which lead to the halt, and soon to be delisting, may have been a strategic move to screw shortie by trapping the beast and giving the ADR a continuance in its own right until the company restructures and gets its paperwork in order - OUCH!
